lez's man a pestilent fellow. Oratore frequently call that man a pest, who acts perniciously to the commonwealth. But this foul- mouthed slanderer was not ashamed to asper-se Paul with this odious name, when, notwithstanding he exhorted all to forsake wicked courses, and embrace earnestly the virtues that lead to salvation. So at this day very many are called plagues and pes- tiferous, who are falsely branded with the reproach of perverse heresy, because they reject the doctrines and commandments of men, in matters of saith and divine worship, that they may stand fast to that alone most wholesome doctrine, delivered in the holy scriptures.
